page.title: 02Village Crafts:Chinnor etc
page.content: Lacemaking in Chinnor Chinnor lace was once extremely famous and most village women practised it. However, this craft is now only pursued by one or two women, and now only as a hobby. In the 19C. lacemaking was a flourishing cottage industry with Lace Schools etc. Older women would train and instruct young girls in the craft. Sydenham Crafts There are still two lacemakers living in Sydenham who display their work locally. In Sydenham a man makes reproduction furniture, while another restores antiques; one lady does smocking, an additional woman, needlework. There are two women who spin wool, one for weaving, the other for knitting. There is a potter also in Sydenham village.
